newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RMB buys Aegis stake from NBS.
newsitem.headline: RMB buys Aegis stake from NBS.

text.p: RMB Holdings Ltd said on Tuesday it would buy a 50 percent stake in South African short-term insurer Aegis from NBS Holdings Ltd for 125 million rand.
RMB said in a statement the transaction will see it, together with subsidiary Momentum Life Assurers Ltd which owns the other 50 percent, take 100 percent control of Aegis.
The deal would be funded from part of the proceeds of RMB Holdings' sale of its 20 percent stake in NBS Holdings Ltd to Boland Bank Holdings Ltd, a deal also announced late on Tuesday.
The sale had earned RMB Holdings 1.3 billion rand, it said.
RMB Holdings acquired the NBS stake for 300 million rand in 1993, which meant its sale would yield a net capital profit in excess of one billion rand.
Chairman GT Ferreira said that in the medium to long-term, the company planned to use its cash flush position to develop and acquire new business opportunities both locally and abroad.
